message: @tarek_ziade is about to speak on the Python infrastructure around Firefox's Sync feature in Centennial 1.  If you care about privacy you will like Firefox's Sync better than Chrome's sync :)
I just wish ff would give me my memory back when I close a tab...
What I missed when I tried FF4 was selective tab sync the way that TabRocket does it.
Though, the fact that Chrome doesn't need the Flash Plugin is a pretty big win for Chrome on the security front.
This is a big reason I might move back to FF4 when it's released...
I don't want all of my personal tabs at work, ditto the other way around.
@offby1 each app has its own tabs but you can click on "show tabs from another computer" -- I find it useful on Firefox Mobile when I want to finish reading something I started on my laptop
All data should be encrypted client side like Sync before sent to servers.  Here's a nice tool that anyone can use to do fast, native JS encryption https://github.com/daviddahl/domcrypt

i thought this was really suspicious at first but the reason it works (turning a small key into a large one) is that you only get one try to type in the right key, so it's secure against eavesdropping/MITM
@dash, I'm not in the talk. where can I see this network org diagram?
